reference.title: Checking pip Installation
reference.shortdesc: How to quickly confirm if pip is installed on your system.

section.title: Overview
section.p: Verifying if pip is installed is essential for installing Python packages, including Matplotlib. Without pip, you won’t be able to manage Python packages effectively.

section.title: Steps to Check pip Installation
section.p: To check if pip is installed, follow these steps:

ol.li:
Open your command line interface (CLI):
Windows: Use Command Prompt or PowerShell.
macOS or Linux: Use the Terminal.
Enter the command to check the version of pip.
Look at the output. If pip is installed, you should see information about its version.
If pip isn't installed, you'll get an error message indicating the command was not found.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: If pip is not installed, refer to the official pip installation guide for installation instructions.

section.title: Additional Information
section.p: It’s a good idea to keep pip updated to the latest version for better compatibility. You can upgrade pip with the appropriate command.
